about.description:
Use airflow to author workflows as directed acyclic graphs (DAGs)
of tasks. The airflow scheduler executes your tasks on an array of
workers while following the specified dependencies. Rich command
line utilities make performing complex surgeries on DAGs a snap.
The rich user interface makes it easy to visualize pipelines
running in production, monitor progress, and troubleshoot issues
when needed.

When workflows are defined as code, they become more maintainable,
versionable, testable, and collaborative.
about.summary:
Airflow is a platform to programmatically author, schedule and monitor
workflows

name: airflow-with-sentry
raw_recipe:
# This file created by conda-build 3.21.4
# ------------------------------------------------

package:
  name: airflow-with-sentry
  version: 2.2.0
source:
  fn: airflow-2.2.0.tar.gz
  patches: null
  sha256: f53d7fafec8ffe7ce87b39be7842adca67b1215f841a2390dd2e5d17b4a0161d
  url: https://github.com/apache/airflow/archive/2.2.0.tar.gz
build:
  noarch: false
  noarch_python: false
  number: '0'
  string: py39hf3d152e_0
requirements:
  host:
    - _libgcc_mutex 0.1 conda_forge
    - _openmp_mutex 4.5 1_gnu
    - ca-certificates 2021.10.8 ha878542_0
    - ld_impl_linux-64 2.36.1 hea4e1c9_2
    - libffi 3.4.2 h9c3ff4c_4
    - libgcc-ng 11.2.0 h1d223b6_10
    - libgomp 11.2.0 h1d223b6_10
    - libstdcxx-ng 11.2.0 he4da1e4_10
    - libzlib 1.2.11 h36c2ea0_1013
    - ncurses 6.2 h58526e2_4
    - openssl 3.0.0 h7f98852_1
    - python 3.9.7 hf930737_3_cpython
    - readline 8.1 h46c0cb4_0
    - sqlite 3.36.0 h9cd32fc_2
    - tk 8.6.11 h27826a3_1
    - tzdata 2021c he74cb21_0
    - xz 5.2.5 h516909a_1
    - zlib 1.2.11 h36c2ea0_1013
  run:
    - airflow >=2.2.0,<2.2.1.0a0
    - blinker >=1.1
    - python >=3.9,<3.10.0a0
    - python_abi 3.9.* *_cp39
    - sentry-sdk >=0.8.0
test:
  commands:
    - pip check
  imports:
    - airflow
    - airflow.sentry
    - sentry_sdk
  requires:
    - pip
about:
  description: 'Use airflow to author workflows as directed acyclic graphs (DAGs)

    of tasks. The airflow scheduler executes your tasks on an array of

    workers while following the specified dependencies. Rich command

    line utilities make performing complex surgeries on DAGs a snap.

    The rich user interface makes it easy to visualize pipelines

    running in production, monitor progress, and troubleshoot issues

    when needed.


    When workflows are defined as code, they become more maintainable,

    versionable, testable, and collaborative.

    '
  dev_url: https://github.com/apache/airflow
  doc_url: http://pythonhosted.org/airflow/profiling.html
  home: http://airflow.apache.org
  license: Apache-2.0
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: 'Airflow is a platform to programmatically author, schedule and monitor

    workflows

    '
extra:
  copy_test_source_files: true
  final: true
  recipe-maintainers:
    - halldc
    - sodre
    - xylar
